alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bradford, northwestern Alachua, southwestern Union and south central Columbia Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms over Upland Pines, or 7 miles west of Worthington Spring, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Worthington Spring, Alachua, Worthington Springs, Upland Pines, Groves, Providence, La Crosse, Brooker and Dukes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua
